Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are numerous events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation around the world. While providing a comprehensive list of 10 events might not be feasible, here are some notable examples across various platforms:

1. United Nations Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) COP 15: The 15th meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the CBD takes place in Beijing, China, in 202.
2. World Wetlands Day: An annual event celebrated on February 2 to raise awareness about the importance and benefits of wetlands.
3. Earth Hour: A global movement organized by the World Wildlife Fund (WWF), where participants switch off their lights for an hour to raise awareness about climate change.
4. World Environment Day: Organized by the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), this event takes place annually on June 5 to raise awareness about environmental issues.
5. World Rivers Day: A celebration held annually on the last Saturday of September to bring attention to the importance of rivers and strive for their conservation.
6. World Oceans Day: Another UN-organized event, celebrated on June 8 to highlight the significance of oceans and promote ocean conservation efforts.
7. International Day for the Conservation of Nature: Observed on November 28, this day encourages the protection and preservation of the planet's natural resources.
8. World Wildlife Crime Technology Challenge: Hosted by the National Geographic Society and the U.S. Agency for International Development, this challenge invites innovators to develop technologies that combat wildlife crime.
9. IUCN World Parks Congress: A forum organized by the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN), bringing together professionals and decision-makers to discuss strategies for protected area management and conservation.
10. Our Planet: A Netflix original documentary series produced by Sir David Attenborough, showcasing the wonders of our planet and emphasizing the need for environmental conservation.

source.content: If there’s one day of the year you can legitimately encourage friends and colleagues to do something for the environment Earth Day on 22nd April is itThis Earth Day Do Action Plan has a wide range of sustainable actions So whether you’ve new to climate action or could give David Attenborough a run for his money read on It’s World Wildlife Day on the 3rd of March and a brilliant excuse to connect your colleagues and community with nature This World Wildlife Day Do Action plan is for you to share and use to engage your people It’s teeming with everyday tips and tools that help wildlife And the best news of all No matter how much or how little people know there are tips and actions for all levels of engagement and understanding We’ve pulled together our favourite water saving actions that we hope will inspire you your colleagues and people in your community to start making small water saving changes this World Water Day

We’re focussing in on three of our favourite global environment days 🚴‍♀️ World Bicycle Day  Friday 3rd June🌎 World Environment Day  Sunday 5th June🌊 World Oceans Day  Wednesday 8th June It’s a busy time so we’ve put an action plan together for you to make your month simple and impactful It’s World Wildlife Day on the 3rd of March and a brilliant excuse to connect your colleagues and community with nature This World Wildlife Day Do Action plan is for you to share and use to engage your people It’s teeming with everyday tips and tools that help wildlife And the best news of all No matter how much or how little people know there are tips and actions for all levels of engagement and understanding

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: In Do Nation, the main environmental impact metrics reported include carbon emissions (CO2), water usage, and waste reduction. These metrics are used to track the overall environmental impact of various campaigns and activities. Additionally, other sustainability factors such as health, well-being, community development, biodiversity, and pollution reduction may also be considered in a broader sense of sustainable development goals (SDGs).

source.content: Calculating the impact of your Do Actions is at the heart of Do Nation This article explains how and why we calculate carbon savings for the Do Actions How do you calculate the carbon savings Do you only measure CO2 impacts Measuring the impact of campaigns We also measure waste and water savings although this impact data is only available on Plus and Enterprise programmes on the programme admin’s impact dashboards We believe in a lot more than just carbon water and waste though We're strong advocates of a more holistic view of sustainability health wellbeing community biodiversity pollution - all of it matters Hopefully that’s made clear through the site And one day we might even have metrics for these too Organisations with Pro or Plus accounts can view the impact of their campaigns via the admin dashboard within their organisation's page  This is outlined in more detail in our article Measuring the impact of your campaign

basis to level things out Aside from the impact already available through your dashboards carbon water and waste saved etc this impact report will also dig into the impact it has had on your staff’s health wellbeing and pride and what SDGs they’ve contributed towards Lovely We’ve got a bunch of B Corps on board already and lots more on their way… Subscriptions start at £10 / month Our Pro subscription is £1 / employee / month and we recommend a minimum subscription of three months There is also a Plus option that includes a bit more customisation and more detailed impact reporting as well as account management support from me We really recommend this option to any organisations with more than 50 employees; drop me a line for more info Simple register interest here and I’ll send over info on getting set up It’d be best to create your campaigns before Christmas so that you’re all ready to go when you’re back in January but the time needed to prepare really depends on your size The

This article covers how to find and share your campaign's impact figures Do Nation is built on the power of individual action adding up to significant change Our impact dashboard feature allows you to share your programme's aggregated data in stats that are quantified to bring them to life Rob made a pledge to waste less food saving 86 kg CO2 Not enough to make a dent on climate change alone but a significant contribution to his team’s total of 76 pledges and 2 kg CO2 And together across all their offices innocent’s employees have saved as much carbon as 4 flights from London to Paris That's empowering - and has motivated Rob to keep stepping up his efforts There are four impact dashboards available in all our subscriptions Plus and Enterprise accounts also have access to pledge and survey data 1 Pledges this tab shows the potential impact of pledges made - ie what they’d save over the two months if each one was successful You can use the bar charts to see when peaks of activity were

data 1 Pledges this tab shows the potential impact of pledges made - ie what they’d save over the two months if each one was successful You can use the bar charts to see when peaks of activity were and so assess which communications efforts have been particularly effective 2 Confirms once users start to reach the end of their two month pledge period this tab gets really interesting It shows the confirmed carbon water and waste savings both over two months and extrapolated for annual savings too 3 Do Actions you can use this chart to see which actions have been most popular and which have saved the most carbon That can be pretty handy for informing sustainability priorities and initiatives going forward 4 Impact stats This is where things get fun Here’s a huge wall of stats about your impact Use them in your internal and external comms to engage people in the campaign We can also send you an excel download of the detailed pledge data as well as the more in-depth impact survey some

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Based on the provided information, I cannot definitively determine if the organization has made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility. However, there are indicators suggesting that the organization may prioritize such values. They mention being a B Corp themselves and working with 14 other B Corps, which emphasizes sustainability and responsible business practices. Additionally, they discuss engaging employees in healthy and environmentally friendly actions, demonstrating a focus on employee wellbeing and environmental impact.

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: The company offers several subscription plans called "Pro", "Plus" and "Enterprise". These plans cater to organizations of varying sizes and sustainability goals. The Pro plan includes basic customization, leaderboards, and impact dashboards for £1 + VAT per employee per month. The Plus plan builds upon this foundation with additional features, while the Enterprise plan provides even more advanced capabilities tailored to specific organizational needs. Additionally, there are various tools and resources available within the platform, such as Do Actions, reporting dashboards, and user management features.

Commerce & Products.question: Are there any promotional events, expos, or sales for these offerings? If yes, list them.
Commerce & Products.result:
Yes, there are various promotional events, webinars, expos, and sales related to Do Nation's Pro Plus and Enterprise subscription tiers. Some of these include:

1. Free Trials: Both Pro and Pro Plus plans offer a 2-week free trial, allowing potential customers to test the platform before committing to it.
2. Webinars: Regular webinars are conducted to educate users about the platform's features, benefits, and best practices. These webinars also provide an opportunity for users to ask questions and seek guidance.
3. Intro Calls: For larger organizations, Do Nation offers intro calls with Flynne to discuss specific requirements and obtain a personalized quote.
4. B Corp Challenges & Events: Do Nation participates in various B Corp challenges and events throughout the year. These events often feature special promotions, discounts, or exclusive offers for participants.
5. Industry Expos & Conferences: Do Nation attends and exhibits at industry conferences and expos, providing opportunities for networking, learning about new features, and exploring potential partnerships or collaborations.
6. Sales & Promotions: From time to

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: There are several key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce. One example is the collaboration between Pukka Herbs and the Soil Association, which helps promote sustainable practices within the herbal tea industry. Another notable collaboration is the one between B Lab and B Corporations, where both organizations work together to create positive social and environmental impact through businesses. Additionally, there are various initiatives such as the Rainforest Alliance Certification Program, Fair Trade, Fair Wild, and Fair for Life, which aim to improve sustainability and ethical sourcing across different industries. These partnerships and collaborations help drive progress towards creating a more responsible and sustainable global economy.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: There could be various employment or educational opportunities available depending on factors such as location, field of interest, qualifications, experience, etc. Some common types of opportunities include full-time jobs, part-time jobs, internships, apprenticeships, volunteering positions, online courses, certification programs, degree programs (bachelor's, master's, PhD), professional development workshops, and many more. To find out about specific opportunities, one can explore job boards, company websites, industry associations, educational institutions, social media platforms, networking events, and career counselors.

Welcome to Do Nation’s Action Leaders; a celebration of the people in our communities who are leading by doingDo Nation is here to help keep global heating under 2 degrees and limit devastating impact on communities near and far For this we need radical optimism imagination and action Thought leaders help us see how life can be Action Leaders put it into action This month we’re talking to Julia Chalmers who successfully engaged thousands of employees at SSE in sustainable living Hi Julia great to have you here Tell us a little bit about your world of employee engagement I’ve worked for SSE for 13 years and most of my roles have included engagement either Comms and Engagement Brand Engagement and now Employee Engagement The thing I enjoy most about engagement is data mostly because I’m a geek but I like to really look behind the data to understand what drives and motivates people and to see where we can do better for employees too I like to think what I do makes a difference for my

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events related to job fairs, webinars, workshops, and training programs mentioned throughout the text. Some of these include:

1. Free Consultation: A free consultation is offered to discuss employee engagement programs and learn how they can benefit organizations.
2. Team Leader Training Workshops: These workshops are available exclusively for Plus subscribers, focusing on developing highly engaged team leaders for successful campaigns.
3. B Corp Month Employee Engagement Package: During B Corp Month, Do Nation has created a customizable, easy-to-implement package for fellow B Corps to maximize employee engagement and impact during this special event.
4. Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result: The employee or participant benefits highlighted include leaderboards, customized "Do Action" lists, reporting dashboards, and the ability to control who can pledge towards a campaign. These features enable individuals to track their progress, engage with others, and contribute to sustainability initiatives within their organization.

source.content: Here you will find all features benefits and pricing for Pro Plus and Enterprise subscriptions Each tier is designed to suit different organisational sizes and sustainability goals Pro features and benefits Plus features and benefits Enterprise features and benefits Ideal for smaller organisations Includes basic customisation leaderboards and impact dashboards £1 + VAT / employee / month  Ideal for organisations with + employees or those looking for closer integration with their sustainability strategy All the Pro features plus see where we got the name greater customisation reporting and access to dedicated support from our team We have a zero BS policy and will advise you honestly on the best route for your organisation depending on your aims and objectives for your campaign

without delay from as little as £10 / month opening access to Pro features like leaderboards customised Do Action lists and reporting dashboards Through our secure payment processor Stripe we can now accept credit and debit card payments from Visa MasterCard and American Express This isn’t such a new feature but we haven’t shouted about it yet Upgrading to Pro now unlocks the ability to control exactly who can pledge towards your campaigns When you’re ready to launch your campaigns you upload your employee’s basic details name and email address through your secure user management portal creating a holding account for each of them They will immediately be notified by email and invited to make a pledge This user management feature allows organisations to sign up individual departments or teams for trials without having to pay for the entire employee base – ideal for pilots or for individual sustainability champions It also allows organisations to report more confidently on their impact

for trials without having to pay for the entire employee base – ideal for pilots or for individual sustainability champions It also allows organisations to report more confidently on their impact data and participation rates Last but not least – our home page underwent a bit of a revamp You can now create a new campaign or find a campaign to support directly from the home page Fill in your details below or click an icon to log in You are commenting using your WordPresscom account  Log Out /  Change  You are commenting using your Facebook account  Log Out /  Change

source.content: matters  Everything you buy – you are casting a vote 1 vote = 1 pound The more you are spending money on positive and climate friendly choices the more you are funding the mitigation of climate change and improvement of human environment and animal rights DN Can you share any new habits or actions that you’re taking at the moment Either personally or at work and what led you to these changes VG Yes I’m learning to be led by my very motivated team members Being a leader who is backing up other’s work is more important than always pushing your own vision forward The best ideas come from my team and these new incentives are also pushed through by our team I’m an enabler and a cheerleader for team’s best ideas DN Business has a huge role to play in keeping global heating in check A barrier to change can be the perception that it’s too hard or too expensive What impactful activities have you introduced at Wholegrain Digital that were easier to implement than you expected  VG Like you said

It’s exactly a month since B Inspired; it’s taken me 30 days longer than hoped to share my reflections largely thanks to being kept busy planning our B Corp  Pledge Challenge  Here are six things I heard at B Inspired that have lingered in my thoughts over the last month and I thought worth sharing late as they may be  Colin Mayer from University of Oxford so eloquently summing up what I believe to be the fundamental problem with our current state of capitalism – the key thing that so many entrepreneurs and business school grads seem to have forgotten  “The purpose of business isn’t to profit it’s to deliver profitable solutions to the problems faced by people and planet”  That’s a line I’ll definitely be putting to use in the future  Colin went on to give an example of a business who’s been successfully doing this for decades and an example that was movingly close to home for me Novo Nordisk the manufacturer of the insulin in my pocket keeping me alive 24 / 7  The pivotal role of

data… Continue reading → As B Corp month draws to a close we thought it was a good time to review the impact clocked up in our B Corp Pledge Challenge This January and February people across eight B Corps were busy making pledges to ‘B The Change’ in their own personal lives While their pledges are all still in progress – they have two months to try them out before then coming back to confirm how they got on – here’s a summary of the potential impact they could have together if they’re successful Continue reading → I’ve always been a bit of a secret data nerd that’s why we take measuring our impact so seriously at Do Nation So this is my favourite time of year at Do HQ impact report season I’ve been knee deep in excel charts and pivot tables for the last few weeks Heaven I thought I’d take a few moments to emerge from my data-induced reverie to share some of the most surprising and unsurprising stats from this year’s Do Data Continue reading → As I cycled across Provence last week I

surface initiatives Companies including Leap DiSRUPT Agency Articulate Marketing Standing on Giants x+why Micro scooters Kyero Vita Coco English Tea Shop Centrus advisors and Pukka Herbs have all signed up to Do Nations annual B Corp Challenge  As a B Corp itself the Do Nation challenge includes a bespoke package of support and resources for organisations to run successful employee engagement programmes  We have a confession to make Up till the other week our website had a carbon footprint that we were not particularly proud of We’re focussing in on three of our favourite global environment days 🚴‍♀️ World Bicycle Day  Friday 3rd June🌎 World Environment Day  Sunday 5th June🌊 World Oceans Day  Wednesday 8th June It’s a busy time so we’ve put an action plan together for you to make your month simple and impactful

Over the latter half of  we were busy building a bunch of new features here in the Do HQ – from new Do Actions to online payment Many organisations use Do Nation as a tool to support existing events like their internal green weeks fair-trade fortnights or World Environment Day activities It’s perfect for that use – simple to set-up customisable and gives legacy to these events through long-term behaviour change So we created a page to list upcoming events and register interest If there’s enough interest in a particular event we’ll even create an inter-organisation leaderboard as we did for Waste Less Live More week We’ve added ten new Do Actions falling into two broad camps food things like Sweet temptations Well oiled and You mug and personal development Voice up and Get outta here   In fact these have already earned a blog all unto their own Some of these actions are really only relevant to our Pro users – I doubt many people will be running the marathon this year with the aim of

to discover some foods I love to eat or buy regularly like oven pizzas or Nutella use palm oil But it was an eye opener reading the food labels and discovering how many products do use it and I'll definitely continue to check and try to buy alternatives where I can Its easy to find lists of companies and products that use sustainably sourced palm oil - not so easy sometimes to stick to buying the products I look to support companies who are making good progress in switching their sourcing if I can't get a product that contains totally sustainably sourced palm oil I am fully committed to continuing with this - if you see what carnage the industry has wreaked across Asia you will too This is an easy reference list-  One of the harder Do Actions I've done Chester Zoo's shopping list has been a huge help to be confident in knowing which brands source sustainable palm oil having also learnt more about the environmental and social impacts of using unsustainable palm oil more determined

source.content: for applications fall on the following dates You'll be notified within a fortnight of this date If you're successful you can launch your programme any time within the following three months We will select recipients using the criteria; if there are multiple applications meeting our criteria in any given quarter and we are unable to reach a decision internally we will create a shortlist This shortlist will be put to the vote through social media probably Facebook but TBC and you will be invited to encourage your supporters to vote for it The recipient will be selected based on the organisation who receives the most votes

World Wetlands Day Chinese New Year Black History Month Winter Olympics there’s even a Pokemon Day on the 27th go walking It’s a busy monthLet’s pack it with positive everyday climate actionWhether you’re more sustainable than an edible coffee cup or brand new to sustainable living let our Do Actions help you and your community take positive steps to a better future It can be easy to feel hopeless in the face of climate change But don’t be glum chum There’s hope in every corner you just need to know where to look Here’s our round up just some of the climate-related good news stories from  and the Do Actions that celebrate them It’s 8am Monday morning 8th October The headlines of the IPCC’s latest stark report on the state of climate change are running through my head while the sound of rocks falling and ice cracking are ringing through my ears As I sit and gaze out at the tongue of the mighty Bossons Glacier having run up here to digest the news and clear my head tears well in my eyes

UCLan have been nominated in the student engagement category for the Green Gown Awards  We’re doubly excited that they were also awarded a Green Impact Gold Award and the Environmental Innovation Award at last night’s  NUS Awards We’re very proud to have been involved in their achievements this year Changing behaviour is a tricky subject Universities know that engaging both their students and their staff around sustainability is good for the bottom line as well as being great for the environment but making it fun instead of preachy can be difficult Over the last five years we’ve learned that the secret to making a big impact isn’t grand gestures – it’s small daily habit-forming lifestyle changes We’ve been putting this knowledge to use with the University of Chester for the last two years helping to engage their students in a fun and open way Continue reading → Throughout the programmes we have run with our clients we have got to know what works and what doesn’t This means we have

Additionally, Do Nation works closely with other organizations to learn from their experiences and share best practices related to environmental sustainability and climate change mitigation efforts.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: Yes, there are several joint events, projects, and initiatives involving B Corporations (B Corps) and Do Nation. One notable example is the annual B Corp Retreat, where both B Corps and Do Nation come together to discuss, collaborate, and celebrate their collective efforts towards creating positive social and environmental impact through business practices. Additionally, B Corps often participate in Do Nation's pledge challenges, such as the recent "B Inspired" challenge, where employees from B Corps committed to taking specific actions related to climate change and sustainability. Finally, there might also be individual partnerships between specific B Corps and Do Nation, focused on particular projects or initiatives.

Here comes the juicy bit What do our most successful programmes have in common Relevance friendly competition and community spirit Plan and customise the finer details of your campaign to make it as relevant as possible to your organisation This will help people connect engage and then pledge Three for the price of one  Set a relevant target so here's the truth; we see poor engagement when pledgers see targets as arbitrary and struggle to make a meaningful connection with the bigger picture Set campaign targets that strongly align with your organisation's strategies Then communicate the link consistently and persistently Read our guide to setting relevant targets  Customise your Priority Do Actions we’ve got over 60 actions we call them Do Actions From using a reusable coffee cup to avoiding unsustainable palm oil there's something for everyone Prioritise five that support your goals and values Read our guide to choosing Priority Do Actions  Use incentives we don’t want to over-egg the

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations include increasing team performance by improving team bonds and having a shared purpose; uniting people in tackling climate change; promoting a culture of knowledge sharing and connection; improving internal informal networks and communication; and contributing to the overall impact of the B Corp movement. Through these collaborative efforts, participants aim to achieve common goals while benefiting from each other's expertise, resources, and perspectives.
